result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph W Harris

records.addlTxt:
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.

Court orders the defendant to pay $75.00 towards restitution per month. 
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.

Defendant Joseph W Harris in court.  Attorney Cassidy Sandoval Baker in court for Joseph W Harris.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Review hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant waives Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Case adjourned for Arraignment.
Oral No Contact Order with JL or their address
Court orders no use or possession of any firearms or dangerous weapons, no applications for CCW permit

Defendant Joseph W Harris in court.  Attorney Cassidy Sandoval Baker in court for Joseph W Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
